review: Had the best service here ever from a guy named Tony! Ask for him when going in. He got us drinks quick and was always refilling, got the order correct, and was very friendly and nice. The food was also very delicious. Would recommend the Red Robin burger. I liked how they had a petite burger which was just the right size. :)

worst red robin service I've had. Red Robin's are great, but my server experience has been SO MUCH BETTER at all the other locations I've gone to. The server redeemed herself at the end, but still made my whole experience crappy. Good thins about this location? Its right by the freeway, close to the mall, its huge, and clean.

Went there for lunch a week or so ago. Had the Patty Melt for lunch and shared fried zucchini for an appetizer with my friend. My patty melt was awesome! Full of flavor and the fries were super fresh. Great service too!

Well you can't go wrong with red robin! Their food is always the best no matter what state you are in ! Love their fries and absolutely in love with their burgers!!!!! It is worth the calories! Best lunch I had today

Red Robin has great burgers and bottomless steak fries. I usually get the Bonsai Burger but this time I tried the Chili Cheese burger. It was good, messy and huge! Their shakes are also pretty good, I wouldn't say my favorite but if I'm there I usually get one. Tip - ask for Fry Sauce with your fries! The service and overall atmosphere at Red Robin is generally pretty good, nothing fancy or anything out of the ordinary but good for a decent  meal.

location: Salt Lake City, Salt Lake City, UT
review: Worst Red Robin experience ever. We first sat down and we're 2 of 6 people in the entire restaurant and took about 15 minutes for anyone to talk to us.  We inquired about the beer prices in which our server had no idea what they were.  We eventually made a decision on what beer (even though it was overpriced) and they had their manager come double check our ID's.  She was straight up rude and thought that we were using fake ID's.   We requested to have a basket of fries brought out prior to having our burgers for the wait.  This has never been a problem in the past but we were told they weren't able to do this.   Finally we received our burgers and those were fine.  The server asked if we wanted fry sauce and we did.  Took him another 15 minutes to bring the fry sauce out.    I've never felt the need to write a bad review about a restaurant until now.  We were totally uncomfortable the entire time we were there and if it weren't for the food I would have given this place 1 star.
Just a good place for a burger and endless steak fries. With that chain restaurant feel all around you.

Royal burger! Royal burger! Royal burger! Royal burger! royal burger! ROYAL BURGERRRRR!!! Meat, cheese, lettuce, tomato, a frickin EGG!! and the holy grail of any burger. BACON!!  Don't eat anywhere selling imposter royalty! OBEY ME! I am BACON LORD!! ...get it!!

Such horrible service. Our food took forever and after we got it we didn't see our server for 40 minutes. I've been coming here for years and it's just gone downhill and I have not had a good experience for a while. The French onion soup was too salty and the bread and cheese on top were overdone. This is one of the last restaurants I would choose to go to in the future.

This Red Robin turned out to be a good gathering spot due to the convenience location in Mid-Valley and close distance from Fashion Place Mall.  Parking can be a little strange with a small few rows near the entrance then a big open space in the back. Food seems to be same as other Red Robin I had in the past, although they serve those fruit-fruit girly burgers, their fries and seasoning are always a decent guilty pleasures.  Throw in a shake will make everything exploded.  I had a beer float here once, it was mediocre, and the manager had to ID me himself, aside from that, I did not get much harassment on ordering alcohol like another chain I visited.

I called in this afternoon, at about 3pm, to order a Whiskey River BBQ Chicken Salad for carry out. Before I could place my order, they asked if I could hold, and of course I told them I would.  I waited for 2 minutes...then 5, then 8. Still on hold, I started driving towards the restaurant. While driving, the call duration hit 10 minutes.   I called from my second (work) cell phone to see what was going on, and if I could get anyone to pickup. No answer.  At 15 minutes the phone call hung up.  I was half way there, and had not even got my order in.  I called back, told them what was going on, and then was put on hold for 2 more minutes while they got someone that could take my order.   I finally got someone on the phone, put in my order, and asked what the breakdown was. Of course there was no real answer, but they would "see about getting (me) a discount", and that my salad would be ready in 15 minutes. I was just about to the restaurant when my order was put in, and obviously steamed.  I was so frustrated with Red Robin, that after I hung up, I could not bring myself to walk in there and pick up my food. I doubt I will ever go back, as this unprofessional experience has left me with a terrible impression.

Love the onion rings they have with that tangy fry sauce.  I had the chicken teriyaki burger and it was messy but delicious.  Add a beer and it made for a nice evening.  Service was friendly and responsive during the refills.  Overall a great experience.

Forgot to add my review last week...  The kids wanted burgers and fries but I wanted to sit down in a restaurant. Red Robin was the halfway point.  Never had fry sauce but our fries devoured it after the first taste:) Service from the time we walked in until the time we left was excellent!

I like Red Robin and love the onion rings.  Stopped in for lunch today after the farmers market and were greeted right away and seated right away.  Our server stopped by our table as soon as we sat down and got drinks for us. I almost always get the Royal Red Robin Burger.  Its a tasty burger with an egg on it.  Lets be honest it doesn't get much better than that.  Pair that burger with some onion rings and you're in heaven.  I must admit that even though I love the burger I just mentioned I did get a salad as I have seen the calorie content of aforementioned favorite meal. I got the cobb salad.  It may not have hit the spot like a burger and onion rings but it was real good.

Chain restaurant.  It was okay.  Food is good not great.  Waitress was cute and did a good job.  We had burgers and some kids food.  Onion rings are awesome. My grandson had his birthday lunch here and they didn't sing to him!  Sad. We sang really loud. He got a free Sundae.  I called ahead for a table for 11.   The information didn't get to the hostess but luckily they weren't busy so she could accommodate our group.  The shakes are delicious.  I love steak fries and these could have been fresher.  Would prob go again but not for a special occasion.  Crown burger is just as good and tons cheaper.

How many ways can you spell disappointment? Let's start with the waitress. Her lack of attentiveness was on par for someone in a fast food joint. Not only did she stand over me, clicking her pen, while I was trying to decide what to order; but she also took it upon herself to decide how we wanted our burgers cooked (she didn't ask us). We had to beg for fries and felt like a toddler trying to get his distracted mom's attention when we were trying to her refills. The plan was to let the manager know when he came by, but he ran past quicker than a mouse in a cat party. All in all the food was good, but the service was memorable, in a bad way.

came here for lunch on sunday and it was pretty busy at 2 PM.  we were greeted warmly and quickly seated in a booth as requested.   i ended up getting the royal red robin burger lettuce wrapped with garlic fries.  i tried the garlic sauce, but didn't like it and didn't feel like it was worth the extra 75 cents. their regular fry sauce is good enough.  my hamburger was delicious and i love how they wrap it so well with lettuce.  their fries were yummy too and we had about three refills. our server was really good.  she was slow to start, but that picked up later and she ended up providing excellent customer service.

My wife and daughter went to this location last week and had some of the worst service they've ever experienced. The waiter forgot their appetizer and when reminded (after having brought the entree) still took a great deal of time to deliver it. You'd think a faux pas like that would spark the realization that a bit of attention was needed. Nope. The entree took quite awhile to get, the appetizer, even longer and with that they sat with empty water and lemonade glasses for half the meal. No refill was ever offered. The food was fine. But the service was simply abominable. She left him one dollar  as a tip, and left a note of complaint on the back of the receipt. I'm sure the waiter simply assumed she was cheap and didn't have the honest guts to show the note to his manager.

The DGB burger was a pleasant surprise. Who'da thunk a roasted tomato could pack so much flavor?! The fries were a bit on the saggy side, but the service was great, the garlic aioli was decent, and the $3 wedge salad portion was huge and delicious. Next time, it's time to take advantage of the all-you-can-drink root beer float.

Though i forget the name of our waitress- She was quick, smiley, I never had an empty glass and bottomless fries were in fact bottomless! She even laughed at my jokes and appeared only mildly annoyed by my nonsense!  The food is good. On par with any other one i've been to. Greasy, killer burgers.  Dipping sauce with the fries is straight up om nom status. I would give it a five star, as our experience there was enjoyable.. however my little brother did get food poisoning the next day, and was in bed for two. But only one person out of three are odds i can deal with!

Terrible service from beginning to end!  My mom and I got to the Red Robin and told 2 people that were at the hostess desk that we had 2 other women coming to meet us and we gave them our last name.  25 minutes later I called my sister-in-law to see where they were.  They had seated them somewhere else and they were waiting for us.  They came to meet us.  We had already received waters for all.  The waitress came and took our order at 6:30.  At 7:00 she brought out 2 orders of fries that we had ordered with our dinner.  COLD.  We caught the manager - CHRISTOPHER - who took them back.  10 min later, our dinners came w/o fries.  Manager CHRISTOPHER then brings back 1 order hot fries.  Throughout the night the mgr cks on other tables but avoids us.  HORRIBLE service!  Had to ask for a dessert menu.  Never refilled our waters, had to ask for a refill of coke.  CREDIT - they had an awesome app for allergies menu.  Never going there again.

Lesson learned..when going to a burger joint order a burger. I had the prime rib sandwich (aka French dip) and it was terrible. For what they were charginging I was expecting something awesome but I've had better French dip sandwiches at Arby's and paid far less for them. The fries are awesome but I doubt I'll go back.

We recently went to Red Robin in Murray for dinner.  The wait to be seated was OK, 10-15 minutes.  Unfortunately, we waited 35-40 minutes for our food to be served after ordering.  Our server apologized many times for the delay, and claimed "the manager" either got our order wrong or served our burgers to other guests.  Either way the service was incredibly poor, and the French fries are mediocre to poor.  Appears this Red Robin location is poor in food delivery process!

Just got takeout - blue burger & guacamole burger. Wife says her blue burger is OK. My guacamole bacon burger was dreadful. Burnt taste. Guacamole tasted off, old. Just didn't taste fresh. Not a particularly good experience.

Food was ok, service was a bit poor.  We came in and were sat next to a wall full of pictures. One of these (huge) pictures fell right next to us and barely missed my 4 year old - it was scary!! No one came to check on us, even though at least 4 staff members saw it happen. We told our server, thinking she may move us, and she just said oh wow, sorry, then left.  A few minutes later, she came and sat another family right on the spot where the picture fell!! We were shocked.  We left as soon as possible and probably won't be coming back to this location.   I give it two stars because the food was just fine, but definitely overpriced.  Also, they have some electrical issues going on (apparently the manager does not pay attention to detail) as the lights went off and on at least 3 times during our 45 minute meal, including the 30 minute wait from the moment our food actually came out. Hopefully other Red Robins are in better condition!

Our group has been sitting here for 35 minutes.  We've been served 1 round of drinks and 1 round of bottomless fries.  ... And I think our waiter just walked out and quit!  Seriously! Edit: the manager took over and did a great job.
Great burgers, good salads, and big, bottomless steakhouse fries! Remodeled in late 2014.

I had a Royal Red Robin burger with a Gluten free bun!! Being diagnosed with celiac disease I never thought I'd be able to eat a burger again two thumbs up for red Robin I plan on going back to have another burger it was delicious and juicy and made to perfection!

If you haven't tried the Royal Red, you haven't lived! It's a tasty burger with an over-easy egg on top. There is something so satisfying about pushing the bun down onto the burger and popping the yolk. They do bottomless fries as well!

So far the tempura zucchini is good and the Golden Spike beer is nice. The service, not so good.  I had to ask for dipping sauce twice and napkins or silverware were not given to me with my app. Eating with my fingers. The young servers are congregating in the corner at the bar. The Robin gourmet cheeseburger had good flavor and chew. The endless steak fries were generic in texture and taste. But the signature blend seasoning and roasted green chile dipping sauce were very good.  Overall a good atmosphere for burgers and beer.  Eat the burger fast, it gets soggy quick.
We love this place! Always a crowd pleaser in our house. The staff is pretty great and the only time I ever had a n issue it was resolved with ONE phone call!

We were seated in the bar area, and the atmosphere was quieter in my opinion since we didn't have any children around. The bottomless fries were awesome. They have a tasty fry sauce. My burger was good, not great, but also not very expensive. And they gave me a free Sunday for my birthday & didn't do obnoxious singing. Our waiter gave us the right amount of attention and kept our bottomless fries filled.

I really like this Red Robins, I came here with my boyfriend and there were alot of people ahead of us but it went by super quick and we got seated immediately and our waiter was excellent gave us a basket of fries to start off and food came pretty quick too. The ambiance was good the restaurant had a more modern look to it! I liked sitting near the bar area since your drinks can come out faster!

I love Red Robin, it is a great place for a burger fix. I stopped in for lunch, and had a pretty good experience. I will share that the staff was not as friendly and attentive as they normally are in front; I wondered in and was not created at the door... After a couple of minutes, I just wondered into the bar area and sat myself. The waitstaff was great, and came over to take care of me pretty quickly. The menu is full of different burgers, this is defiantly a place where you go for grilled items. The also have some really great drinks, though their prices on drinks are not all that great in terms of deals. However, they do have some really interesting items... such as beer shakes?? I know, it sounds crazy, but have had one before and it is really quite good. The also have bottomless fries, and will bring you some as an appetizer while you are waiting for your food... nice perk. I do like that they give you what would be a serving size of fries with your meal, but will of course bring more out when asked. This is nice, instead of a mountain sized pile that you will end up eating anyway. I like it and am a big fan.

I've been to this location a few times and keep forgetting to write a review for it.  The food is pretty much the same across all the locations.  Consistency is a good thing!  However, their drinks are made with mixers, so if you have a thing against that, avoid the drinks. The service at this location isn't that great.  I like Red Robin but I have had MUCH BETTER service at the West Valley City location. I'll go to Red Robin again but will avoid this location.  I've been here about 3-4 times and experienced consistently sub standard service every time.

It's a chain restaurant, so it's like most other Red Robins. While walking in WE greeted the employee holding the door and he simply stared at us like we were aliens...awkward.  Thankfully everyone else who worked there was very nice. They seated us right away and the waitress was very sweet and helpful.  The food came fast, and was well prepared. Refills came without having to ask (a huge plus in my book).  The inside is very clean and decorated with all sorts of eclectic pictures, posters and whatnot. My kids love Red Robin so without a doubt we will be back here.

I have to say, I am a Red Robin fan, but this location seems to have issues every time I go there. My bff and I ordered food, it took them like 40 minutes after we ordered to get us our burgers. Now I know they aren't butchering no cow's in there. There is no reason why it should take that long to make a burger, unless you end up cooking the fat out of it lol.  So I was full from water by the time my burger came and I wasn't as jazzed to bite into it like I was before getting there. To be fair the waitress gave us 15 percent discount without even us complaining so I give her that. But I'll stick with the other locations for now.

location: Salt Lake City, Salt Lake City, UT
review: Watch out for the service.  I am a huge Red Robin fan, my family and I eat here regularly. We love the food, bottomless fries and the quirky atmosphere. What we don't like is poor service and cold food. We have recently suspended red robin from our pallet pleasing menu. Far too often, our service lacks. From late arrival and cold food to only seeing our waiter/waitress twice during our meal.  It is really going down. I would like to see them make some changes to their staff training. As other locations I have eaten at are spot on with great service, conversation and smiles.

Went there tonight and just threw up everything I ate. They gave me food poisoning. Totally new experience for me. Would rather not have it happen again. Also, one of the faucets in the women's bathroom doesn't work and hasn't in a long time. I guess they don't care to fix things there. Update: I contacted the business and they were very apologetic about the food poisoning. Seems like they took it seriously. They also told me they fixed the faucet.
Waited a while before someone came to take our order . Manager brought out a bunch of appetizers at no charge. Very kind. Will come again.

Food was good, but horrible service.  The waitress was making fun of my 13 yr old daughter, bringing her to tears because she wanted chicken finger and they only had it on the kids meal.  Calling her names like childish and baby.  I will never be returning.
We have always received great service! Food is great also. Love the bottomless root beer float!

Here we sit noon on a Sunday waiting for a table in a empty restaurant. We have party of 8 and just told it would be another 15 minute because they only have two servers on shift . Meanwhile more and more parties of 3&4 are seated. This is not cool. We come early so it will be slow we never expected to be delayed this long in a empty restaurant . So much for celebrating my sons birthday lunch here.

Poor poor poor service. Fries may be bottomless but you'll never see them...or drink refills.....or napkins (finally just went to the bathroom to get paper towels) or your waiter. Food is usually yummy though, tasted off tonight. Maybe try another place but not here

location: West Valley City, Salt Lake City, UT
review: Kids chose this place to come eat after a long day of golfing.  Came here and the host was nice.  As we were seated, the waiter seemed like he did not want to be there.  Didn't smile at all to where I felt uncomfortable with how he approached us.  We didn't even get any complimentary fries plus he never came back to refill our drinks.  Horrible service.  The food took long but it was good.  I would rather go to the one in west valley than to this one just for the service.
Good burgers just the way I like them and good service. I'm a fan.
If you like to wait 45 min for raw gourmet burgers.... By all means this is the place for you. Make sure your up to date on your shots.  They might come in handy.
The food is great. My fiancé and I love to go here very often. Love the fry sauce and fries! And the whiskey burger. Yummmm

I love this place, use to go all the time with an old friend and went recently and service is still excellent and dinner was excellent.  One of my Favorites.  I also love the items on the walls that are very patriotic and just show a lot of care of important dates.

Food was good but service was slow. We had to wait longer than usual for our drinks, food, and check. Tried their wedge salad appetizer, royal red robin burger, and a fiery burger I can't remember the name of. All were very tasty! Also tried their Mai tai and tnt drinks. Tnt tasted great while the Mai tai tasted mostly of liquor.  Also, the women's restrooms stalls were small! It was hard to close the stall without touching the toilet. (GROSS)

I just went here Friday night for my birthday it was a very horrible experience. We waited for over an hour to be seated since we had a large party we were put in a room off to the side I quickly noticed it would not just be us as there were several other tables with people. No one took our order till being there 2 hours they brought us our drinks and finally brought fries to tide us over 20 minutes before receiving our food we did not get our food till after 2 1/2 hours. Our waitress was a complete idiot when people use the term blonde well let's just say it suited her well. She did not even ask my Mother what she wanted to order my friend had to tell her she still needed to order. I had ordered a raspberry Margherita and she brought out a plain one so she had to switch that. My mother said her food was so bad she took it home and gave the meat to her dogs my mother is too nice to say when she doesnt like something she also asked to sub fries for something and had to pay 2 extra dollars. My friend that was sitting next to her got chili with her order and told the waitress she did not like it instead of asking what else she would like she brought her a bigger bowl of the same chili. When my fiance received his burger it had lettuce on it so she offered to make him a new one even after we already waited over 2 hours for our original dishes. When I received my food it was not even warm and the lettuce tasted slimy. My other friend had an order of fries and she sat them down in front of my mother who told her earlier she could not eat fries. When my fiance and I received our bill she charged us for 3 Margheritas not one so then she had to fix our bill as well. This girl needs to find a new job although I'm sure she's too dumb to find one. I will never go here again.... my fiance and I had gone there last year and had an awful experience again we had a male waiter this time and when he approached our table to ask for my order he was clearly very hungover I asked him what kind of sauces they had for my burger and he told me over a million and if he was to tell me them he'd be there all day... I asked him to tell me atleast 5 and he came up with two. I was pregnant at the time and asked when he came back to get extra sauce for my fiance and he reeked so badly of alcohol I threw up I requested to speak to his manager and he took over ftom there. Take away do not patron this location they hire idiots!

Terribly slow. Waited over 30 min for food, never was asked my drink order, server was nice but never checked in (I think she was given more tables than she could handle) and my husband found a FIFO sticker in his coleslaw. I don't know why you would ever eat coleslaw but hold the adhesives next time please! My burger was delicious though!

I don't know if the food industry encourages servers to memorize orders rather than write it down?  But, I'd prefer my server write it down.  In other words, I'd prefer to be impressed by a correct order than my servers memorization skills.  That being said, minus the minor mistakes (tomato on my burger, no ranch dressing for my fries, tomato on my friends burger, no mustard on her burger, and salt on her fries), the Royal Red was on point.  But!  My fries were WAY too salty!

This is one of the family's favorite places to come for a bite to eat. The server wasn't the friendliest, but the dude who seated us was super chatty & more than made up for it. The restaurant has a relaxed & casual atmosphere. The menu has choices galore!  We always get the pretzel bites & the deep fried pickle coins as appetizers; they cost $5 apiece ( appetizers range from $5 - $9 ) & always hit the spot. I got the Red Ramen Burger ( pic & description from their website included ), which was weird but overall not bad. The "bun" consisted of ramen noodles & gave the burger a nice crunchy bite to it. I am glad that I tried it, but it will probably be the only time. They have plenty of delicious burgers ,with a plethora of toppings, to satisfy any taste. The endless fries are a hit & yummy as always. I like the choices of gourmet dipping sauces you can get for your fries. We are usually too full to get dessert or shakes, but they haven't disappointed on the rare occasion that we have. The salty caramel shake is absolutely divine. I try a different burger or dinner item every I come & will be back again & again. Red Robin...YUM!
I like the food a lot. The wraps are great and a decent price. They are little slow with service. Overall they are good place for food.

Red Robin is a great place to sit down and get a burger. They have lots of options and have gently catered to those with gluten allergies. We love this option because now my whole family can come when we go. The kids love the bottomless fries. The service is overall average. Sometimes you get an awesome server and sometimes you get below average service. I do wish the service was a little more consistent like you see at other restaurants in the area.

location: Cottonwood Heights, Salt Lake City, UT
review: If you have a choice between this location and the one on foothill go to the latter. I always avoid this location because of cleanliness issues. The sticky tables are gross, food and smeared fingerprints of ketchup/sauce on the booth seats. It got on my skirt. This location smells bad, really bad, like dirty wet carpet. It reminds me of the smell of an old elementary  school cafeteria, or the liquid you pour out of a used carpet cleaning machine. This is the main reason I have given two stars to this red Robin.   The smell is so unappetizing. Our server jodi did an ok job today. But in past visits we had the unfortunate experience of having a girl named Megan be our server. Megan had friends of hers seated in her section and that's what she was concerned about the whole time. We could barely get her attention for refills all the while she was talking and bringing free food and drinks to her obnoxious friends. That was last year and I still remember what a terrible experience we had and how the place stunk back then as well. As far as the food today, the burger buns were soggy, like wet and falling apart from water and the burgers were cooked to varying temps.  My boyfriends was too rare, barely medium. While his mom's was overcooked and gray. I get the boca burger, which is hard to mess up. But we peeled off the nasty wet buns. Again jodi did ok today, but I doubt I will be back to this location for another year (hopefully).

What a horrible smell. She seated us down by the entrance Im like what is that smell??? So we moved to the bar area. Still was a smell mildew, not clean, fish smell. We decided just a drink and appetizer and go. My lemonade and vodka was strawberry syrup on top of a splash of vodka and lemonade. (beer is safer) because of the smell and cleanliness it makes you gag.  The bone in wings with soggy chips was next. The wings must have come from a baby chicken. Then I take a look at my celery that has brown ends. Not good.

I am a Red Robin fan but this location was disappointing.  It took the waiter awhile to find us but once he did he was very nice and helpful. Food came fast and was good but not as good as the one I usually go to. The 2 stars were mostly because the place was dirty and the staff was running around accomplishing hardly anything.  Bathrooms were dirty, restaurant floor was dirty, the place just seemed tired. I guess it is a franchise, not corporate and maybe that's what made the difference. I write this review in hopes that they will improve,  not to criticize.

$83 for cold, dry food and poor service.... Tonight was my first time eating at Red Robin and I was sadly disappointed. I was taking my girlfriend, mom and sister out for dinner here after hearing a lot of good things about the food. Unfortunately none of the good things held up.  We were created by very friendly staff at the door, but our waiter was an emotionless, inattentive and unfriendly.  My girlfriend's clam chowder was ice cold and her grilled cheese was burnt. She only ate a couple spoons of soup and 3 bites of her sandwich.  My mushroom burger was nearly inedible. The top bun was dry and crumbly, bottom bun was wet and mushy, sautéed mushrooms were cold and unseasoned. I only ate about half of it.  My mom and sister had a rather difficult time eating their burgers as well - they kept falling apart and crumbling. Each only ate a few bites of their burgers.  Everyone's fries were cold and tasted stale.  The total cost of our meal including tip was $83 - highly overpriced in my opinion. I'm a food lover - especially burgers, but this place does not have good burgers.

I know a lot of people that love Red Robin, but I am not one of them. I do not like any of their food choices, I don't care for the French fries either so the unlimited fries doesn't do anything for me. The service is hit and miss here as well. It seems like the  wait to be seated and the wait for the food to arrive are both always way to long. In my opinion if you have another option, then exercise it rather than going to Red Robin.

location: Salt Lake City, Salt Lake City, UT
review: This is a spot that you go to when you are not footing the bill. Red Robin's doesn't feel special to me at all. I ordered a Teriyaki Chicken sandwich and it felt and tasted run of the mill. The service here is awesome my waitress was very attentive and helpful when it came to menu options so I can't knock them for that.

We got pretty good service here. But, I'll start with the star of the show. We go to Red Robin around the country relatively frequently. However, we are rarely greeted and seated as warmly as we were by Liam. He not only seated us, but conversed with us and asked how we were doing and shared how his evening was going. So friendly and he also gave us a salutation as we left. Super kudos for him! I would come back, just for him alone. Great employee you have there, Red Robin! Our server was attentive and efficient. We were very pleased with our experience. Just a minor demerit is that the bathrooms needed some attention while we were there, but I understand we came at a busy time.
There isn't an option for no stars. But that's what I would give it. Asked for a ceasar salad to go and receive wilted romain lettuce with dressing, no croutons or cheese. Very upset.

We called in an order to go. It was ready when we got there. The burgers were good and the fries were good. We didn't get the seasoning for the fries, but did have fry sauce. Maybe they don't do seasoning for to go orders, but I did miss it. They should give packets out with to go orders.

Nothing redeems the horrible services at this particular red robin. Our waitress did come check on us a few times and even took our empty dishes, but never once asked about refills or if we wanted more of our bottomless sides. There were many times that I looked around and couldn't see a single employee. I liked the food, but I can get better burgers at small diners.

Some good burgers and fries. I have stopped here many times for lunch dates with the wife and this is the first time I've decided to review it. Normally, I don't have to fight a crowd to get in and the service is pretty quick. There's definitely nothing to be ashamed about loving endless fries. The fries are pretty meaty so don't expect typical thin fries. I'll endorse their fry sauce for sure.  They do take military and student discounts if that applies.  I would recommend any of their burgers, and specially whiskey river. You have to a BBQ and onion ring kind of dude or dudette. Normally if you don't get an appetizer, your server will bring out fries for you to munch on while you wait.  I wasn't too thrilled with my service today, which knocked it down to a two star. I think my server was having a bad day or something. The only smile we got was when she handed me back the credit card receipt for the tip. No refills. Had to ask for napkins forks and condiments. I thought about mentioning her name, but after some thought, I'm not that big a jerk.

Environment is superb! I have a problem with the wait staff though. Each time I have gone they have not been very pleasant and that is a huge part of the dining experience to me. The food has typically been pretty good except this last time the burger was super bland. For some reason bottomless fries didn't feel bottomless as I had to ask for more. There was a location in Idaho I went to and they were amazing. This one needs improvement.

Been to this location 20 times and been happyb19 of them. As of today I will never go back. Ice water was undrinkable. I don't know if they served us with dirty glasses or if it was old ice cubes or if the water is really that bad. I can still taste it. Yuck. I asked to purchase a bottle of water but they do not have it. The burger they brought me wasnt the same as the burger described in the menu and forget bottomless fries... We were never even asked if we would like more. To many great burger joints in town to pay $13 for horiable service and water thats undrinkablee.

Let me start by saying this definitely is NOT your typical Red Robin. 1 star because you have to give at least 1, so 1 star for our waitress who was this place's saving grace. The floors were filthy, the high chair looked filthy (later saw why. They don't wipe down high chairs after use). Burger were ok, fries were over cooked. One of the bussers smelled like he hadnt showered in weeks and kept cleaning with a musty smelling rag near us. Was hard to eat. Then he sat down at a table with friends and was walking around eating fries while cleaning. The staff just seemed sad just like this location. In a sketchy area too.

Our Server was named Jesse and if he's curious why he got a crappy tip and a note on the bill this is where he will find that info. First let's start with the fact that I asked what types of drinks they had and his response "coke products", I hadn't even picked up my menu yet and didn't want to be rude by making him wait. Turns out they have all kinds of lemonades and milkshakes etc. Husband and I ordered 2 cokes and when he came back he asked if we were ready. I ordered the bleu Ribbon burger as my husband got the tavern double although it didn't seem like a double anything. Jesse then asked for our menus back,  like we were planning on keeping them. The food came quickly which was nice but when Jesse walked away my husband realized he wanted campfire sauce for his fries and opted to wait until our waiter came back. I told him that wasn't happening. Anyone who's gone into a restaurant with kids should know the feel when the waiter wants nothing more than for you to take your kids and leave,  well the whole experience had that feel. Maybe because I had on a halter top and my husband was in his work uniform? Dunno but I know the look a waiter gives you when they don't think you're going to tip them well. And this time Jesse, you were right.  Didn't come back to the table until we were completely done,  though you did walk by our table 5 times to check on the older couple behind us. Don't worry though Jesse,  you won't be seeing us again. I do not give my business to a company who's employees think they can treat people poorly based on what they look like. Food was ok,  an offer for more fries would have been awesome but oh well,  we curbed our appetite with a restaurant down the street.

The service was great.  I was very disappointed in the change that they made to their salads.  Nothing like they used to be.  The cobb salad used to be the best in town.  That is not the case anymore.  I had the Cobb salad and my husband had the whiskey river.  They now use iceberg lettuce and the chicken on both salads was overdone and rubbery.  Very little of anything on the salads except for plenty of iceberg lettuce.  We will be finding a new plate for salads.

Seems like I cursed myself from writing a good review over a year ago.  Ever since then, the food has been terrible!  In part to my last trip there on 6/6/2017.  We ordered the $7 appetizer (fried zucchini and mushrooms), Nothing at all like what it was supposed to be. (We've ordered this item multiple times) They even tried remaking it 3 times! Finally we just said, forget it.  The mushroom burger was the worst!  They should've just brought me a dish of salt to eat!  You would think that Jenny, the "lead manager", would know how their menu items are supposed to be cooked!  She had NO idea! Really Red Robin?!!

I don't really have bad things to say about the food, I thought my burger and my fries were well cooked and flavorful. The reason behind the two stars is due to how awful the service was. Our hostess acted as though we were being inconvenient for walking in, and our waitress was extremely slow, unfriendly and basically left a bad taste in our mouths. The food took twice as long to come out, and our beverages were constantly empty. It took 25 minutes just to get the check! do yourselves a favor and visit a different location.

Horrible service, had to ask for fries and drinks 4-5 times each. Didn't get my order right at all. Complained to the manager about the service and he completely ignored me and acted like I was worthless. I love Red Robin but do not go to this one, I'll drive across Utah just to avoid this restaurant. DO NOT EAT HERE.  Worst Red Robin I've ever been to, will never come back here.

Food is always pretty good, and at lunch the service is usually pretty standard as well. Last night, our server took forever to get to us, brought appetizers with no napkins (my father in law brought us paper towels from the bathroom so we could wipe our hands because our table was not revisited), our food took forever, which he told us was because the kitchen dropped our ticket and forgot to make it, however when it came out, the burgers were overcooked and dried out (probably sat under a heat lamp), we had to get the server to take our check back because he dropped it and we actually wanted dessert. Just pretty poor service all around. Shout out to Orlando the food runner though, literally the hardest working person in this restaurant last night. He was on top of it. I wish he would have been our server, we might have had a better time.

Food, drink and service were very disappointing. My burger was cold and my husband's was soggy. Waitress was extremely unprofessional and rude. Everything we asked for was an inconvenience to her. A serious waste of money
Well the burgers taste fine, but the services is not up to par, I get the feeling they are always understaffed.
Great burgers and top notch customer service!  I love this Red Robin and come here all the one.  Try the mad love burger!

Food was average, but service was the worst I've seen. We're greeted by the rude front lady who looks miserable. As she walked us to our table, she just threw our menus on the table and ran away without waiting for us. Plus she and some other childish waiter was playing around. This place is unprofessional and I would not be going back here again

Food wasn't even cooked how I asked. Our waitress chelsie d said they could cook my burger with a little pink on it. When I received said burger It was darker than the marianas trench. She was highly inattentive and I even heard her talking to a coworker within earshot of my wife and myself complaining about customers. She shouldn't work there with that attitude. Won't be back. I bet the manager won't even try to rectify this. I will just never be back and will advise everyone to not go there.

This has been the worst experience that I've had since moving to Utah. Servers and other pateons kept looking at us funny as if they never seen people of color. That didn't deter us from ordering our food. We had a waiter that was not real attentive, seemed to want to be elsewhere. We placed our orders and they all came out wrong. Burgers were not cooked properly. We told our waiter what happened and he acted like he could care less. Never apologized for the errors or anything. I asked another person if he was the manager and didn't even confirm. he said he'll have it removed from the bill. We all took a few bites of our meals and were disgusted with the service and didn't finish our meals. At no time the the server come check up on us. Last time I'll go to this Red Robbins or any other elsewhere.

We decided to go here tonight because my wife had a coupon. We were seated fairly quickly and even though we took awhile to decide what we wanted, the food came out quick. The food was good and there was plenty. The wife and I got burgers and my son got the mac n' cheese and the side salad. I like the burgers but next time I think I will try the mac n' cheese, The service was great, she was very fast and efficient.

Gourmet is far from how i would describe this experience. Second bad experience in a small time period. Red Robin has lots of decor to keep the appeal of a "fun filled" place to eat. However, the last few times i have been there, this is about the highlight.  We ordered fried zucchini to start off, as they bring bottomless fries to the table, but the seasoning is a bit overkill. The zucchini was decent and probably the best thing we ate there. I ordered a caprese chicken sandwich and was sadly disappointed. The sauce was bland and the chicken was rubbery like that out of a high school boiling pot.  We had a coupon we tried to use for a "free burger with the purchase of another burger", to which was denied. They couldn't call the burger my friend ordered under that coupon because he got lettuce instead of a bun...weird. Also, you have to purchase 2 drinks in addition to get the $5 burger for free.  The service was mediocre but i had to do a lot of things on my own: Get more napkins, clear the table and stack the dishes in his hands for him, ask multiple servers for a refill on water, etc. I walked out of there $20 meal, that i felt like i could have gourmet myself at home for half the price. I won't be making a return trip anytime soon, and would recommend others search the area for something more memorable.

We were invited to a birthday party here so off we went.  The wraps and grilled chicken gave us some healthy options which we appreciated.  The hamburgers were good but not fantastic.  The Chophouse burger was average and a little dry.  The chocolate malt and vanilla shake was very good.  The fries and smoky fry sauce were also  very good.  Our service was good especially since we had a group of 24.

Don't know if the food was good because the service was horrible. My family & I waited  20 mins to be seated which was fine. When we got a table we literally sat there for 20 mins without one single person greeting or even acknowledging that we were even there. We didn't even get water. People that were seated after us had their drinks & had there order taken before us. We sat there so long we had dinner & dessert figured out.

When we arrived the main dining room was full of screaming and crying kids. We asked, "Can we sit somewhere without kids". To which the Hostess said, "There's kids everywhere." But the dining room on the other side was practically empty (we ended up sitting there after  suggested it). I just think the hostess could have been a lot more accommodating.

Food was fine. Although the kitchen was taking so long for the whole place the manager had to go back and kick them in the pants.  Our waitress was a bit of an over-sharer; not in a good way.  But the menu was what we've come to expect from RR. Got seated immediately. When the food was taking too long, our waitress brought out free fries to all her tables.  It was nice to have a burger on the menu that wasn't $10-$15.

Bottomless Steak Fries!! they had me at bottomless fries :) I have been here a handfull of times, and always enjoy the food. reasonable prices, especially their $6.99 burgers. Recently I saw on their download menu that they use cage-free/hormone-free chicken breasts from family owned farms! hurray for them on keeping the local farmers in business. Overall a great place to come for a family meal, or even a birthday dinner. their online site makes ordering food to go super simple.

Waited 40 minutes for our food and it was cold when it came and wasn't correct. Manager said she wished she could've done something at the time it came out and was nice enough but the waitress never check on things or refilled our glasses so that wasn't really an option. One of the worst experiences at a restaurant I've had in a long time. What a waste of money. Head to any other burger joint in the area over this one. Don't recommend probably won't go back.

The one really cool thing about this location is they have a large separate seating area for the bar. That's really nice when you don't have kids or kids with you. Service was good and the food was tasty, they did forget to bring my sweet potato fries with my meal and brought an extremely small side dish awhile later. That was the only disappointing thing that happened. Our kids enjoyed their burgers and the side sauces, especially the sweet and spicy ketchup.

Not the best Red Robin location. The food took about 30 minutes to come out and was cold upon arrival. The service was horrible. Our waitress was scarce and seemed put out to refill our drinks or to get us more fries (so much for bottomless fries). Won't be going back to this location.
I used to love going here with my family. Today I decided to order takeout and get the chicken bruschetta sandwich (which I used to love). Sad excuse for bruschetta. Really disappointed.
